title: Fans are crazy in love with Ciara and Russell Wilson’s Beyoncé and Jay-Z Halloween costumes
text:
CLOSE Beyonce surprised fans with a trailer for her new Netflix documentary about her iconic Coachella performance called "Homecoming." USA Today

Ciara and Russell Wilson took Halloween to the next level with their recreation of Beyoncé and Jay-Z's "APES**T” music video.

Ciara shared photos and a video of her and her husband's costumes to Instagram Wednesday, recreating the scene where the musical couple stands in front of Leonardo da Vinci’s "Mona Lisa" at the Louvre Museum in Paris. Ciara donned an almost identical version of Beyoncé's pink satin suit, while Wilson looked like the spitting image of Jay-Z in his powder blue suit.

In February, Bey and Jay took home a trophy at U.K. music industry's Brit Awards for best international group, and used their video message acceptance speech to recreate their own music video, standing in front of a portrait of Duchess Meghan draped in pearls and a crown.

Instead of the Mona Lisa (or Duchess Meghan), Ciara and Wilson posed in front of a portrait of Barack and Michelle Obama.

Ciara and Wilson didn't just stop at dressing up like the Carters – the couple even filmed their own music video with the Obama painting.

"From the Wilsons to the Carters to the Obamas... Much Love & Respect," Ciara captioned the video. "We goin Ape $#!%"

Fans commented on the couple's costume, declaring Halloween canceled because Ciara and Russell Wilson already won.

"They won!!! Halloween is over!!!" wrote one fan.

A few mentioned how Ciara did such a great job recreating Beyoncé's look that they were confused for a minute.

"Had to do a double take," wrote one fan while another asked "since when did you look exactly like Beyoncé."

description: Ciara and Russell Wilson recreated Beyoncé and Jay-Z's iconic looks from their 'APES**T' music video for Halloween.
